channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15234] Semijoin cardinality estimation can be improved
item.description: Currently calcite optimization rules rely on (Hive)SemiJoin to represent semi join node, whereas Stats estimate use leftSemiJoin field of Join to estimate stats. As a result semi-join specific stats calculation logic is never hit since at plan generation time HiveSemiJoin is created and leftSemiJoin field of Join is never set.
item.summary: Semijoin cardinality estimation can be improved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
There are two ways to address this:

  • Get rid of leftSemiJoin field in Join and make stats computation logic to work on HiveSemiJoin.
  • Get rid of HiveSemiJoin and make all the rules work on leftSemiJoin field of Join.

I initially went with approach 2) but quickly found out (all?) current calcite rules work correctly with SemiJoin, but dont (and cannot) take into account field hidden in HiveJoin. RelFieldTrimmer, filterJointranspose were I found, but I assume it would be true for many other rules, since otherwise we would get exception on current master. Thus I think option 1) is better here. Also, because function signatures will force a dev to handle HiveSemiJoin, but a field hidden in Join rel node won't. Thus having explicit SemiJoin is more robust.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12839638/HIVE-15234.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12839895 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
jcamachorodriguez Can you take a look?

ashutoshc, patch looks good in general.

I have only one question. Why don't we use HiveSemiJoin in all cases? I think we are always generating HiveSemiJoin instances in any case if we are using the right builders (or we probably should).

yes.. we are constructing HiveSemiJoin in all cases. Though I still use instanceof SemiJoin because some Calcite rules may generate SemiJoin during transformation, and we don't want to fail instanceof check in those cases. Its just a safeguard against future rules, but yes we want to keep HiveSemiJoin in operator pipeline and not SemiJoin.
